page.title: 06Health services in Witney
page.content: In Witney there are two health centres the Nuffield and the Windrush.There are nine docters plus one who is part time.There is one hospital and three district nurses who look after Witney and the surrounding villages. The Ambulance in Witney.There are 10 to 12 ambualanes men 4 ambualanes in Witney.There are 3 red striped ambulances for emergencies.Each of them carries a heart monitor,10to20 splints 2 to 4 oxygen cylinders,3 drips and they are on call 24 hours a day. The meals on wheels service is operated by the members of the Women's Royal Voluntary service in conjunction with the social services the meals are cooked by the Witney Tech.and Bradwell grove hospital,Burford.There are 42 persons partaking meals from the service twice a week.
